title: Open redirect on sign in

activities.message: Please use the submission template including detailed steps to reproduce rather than a video. Thank you!
activities.markdown_message: Please use the submission template including detailed steps to reproduce rather than a video. Thank you!

activities.message:
Summary: If attacker can gain access the user system he can redirect the any website 

Description: Hi Coinbase Security team,
This bug is little bit different then other bug. It need to gain access user machine or Social Engineering. I am also not sure you will accept this as a bug or not. If attacker  gain access user machine and open coinbase login page. He can able to change the URI behind the Inspect element or else he can use Social engineering. When user see the login page and he will put his username and password and click sign in button. After he click Sign in button It will redirect to the website Attacker want. Most of the good website already fix this bug like Facebook. google etc. 

Browsers Verified In:

[firefox 45.9.0]
[add each browser and version number tested in]
Steps To Reproduce:

(Add details for how we can reproduce the issue)

1. First open a Mozila browser 
2. login to this url https://www.coinbase.com/signin?locale=en
3. Right click on the page 
4. choose Inspect Element 
5. Then choose an element from the page
6. Move your cursor to sign in button
7. Click on it
8. then change the url showing on Inspect element
9. Close Inspect element session

After change the inspect element it will look like coinbase login page But when attacker click on sign in button it will redirect the user to attacker phishing page. If you not understand the reproducing step Keep a look at that video I attached. Thanks


List any additional material (e.g. screenshots, logs, etc.)

activities.message:
Hi,

As noted on our [program page](https://hackerone.com/coinbase), [Self-XSS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-XSS) is not a security vulnerability and is not in scope for this program. Please let us know if you find anything else. As this bug requires the user tampering with their own Document Object Model or an attacker having physical access to their unlocked device, it classifies similarly to Self-XSS.

We look forward to your future reports!

Regards,
The Coinbase Team
activities.markdown_message:

As noted on our program page, Self-XSS is not a security vulnerability and is not in scope for this program. Please let us know if you find anything else. As this bug requires the user tampering with their own Document Object Model or an attacker having physical access to their unlocked device, it classifies similarly to Self-XSS.

We look forward to your future reports!

Regards,
The Coinbase Team
